classFeature.name: Arcane Recovery
entries: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
For example, if you're a 4th-level wizard, you can recover up to two levels worth of spell slots.
You can recover either a 2nd-level spell slot or two 1st-level spell slots.

classFeature.name: Ritual Adept
entries: You can cast any spell as a Ritual if that spell has the Ritual tag and the spell is in your spellbook. You needn't have the spell prepared, but you must read from the book to cast a spell in this way.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the wizard spell list.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a student of arcane magic, you have learned to cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules with Wizard spells, which appear in the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Cantrips.
entries: You know three Wizard cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir|level=0}.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Wizard cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Wizard levels 4 and 10, you learn another Wizard cantrip of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Wizard Features table.

entries.name: Spellbook.
entries: Your wizardly apprenticeship culminated in the creation of a unique book: your spellbook. It is a Tiny object that weighs 3 pounds, contains 100 pages, and can be read only by you or someone casting {@spell Identify|Ishiir}. You determine the book's appearance and materials, such as a gilt-edged tome or a collection of vellum bound with twine.
The book contains the level 1+ spells you know. It starts with six level 1 Wizard spells of your choice.

Whenever you gain a Wizard level after 1, add two Wizard spells of your choice to your spellbook. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown in the Wizard Features table. The spells are the culmination of arcane research you do regularly.

entries.name: Spell Slots.
entries: The Wizard Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+.
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To do so, choose four spells from your spellbook. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Wizard levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Wizard Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Wizard spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Wizard, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination, chosen from your spellbook.

If another Wizard feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Wizard spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells.
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with spells from your spellbook.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability.
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Wizard spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus.
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|PHB} or your spellbook as a Spellcasting Focus for your Wizard spells.

entries.name: Expanding and Replacing a Spellbook
entries: The spells you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect your ongoing magical research, but you might find other spells during your adventures that you can add to the book. You could discover a Wizard spell on a Spell Scroll, for example, and then copy it into your spellbook.

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find a level 1+ Wizard spell, you can copy it into your spellbook if it's of a level you can prepare and if you have time to copy it. For each level of the spell, the transcription takes 2 hours and costs 50 GP. Afterward you can prepare the spell like the other spells in your spellbook.

entries.name: Copying the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your spellbook into another book. This is like copying a new spell into your spellbook but faster, since you already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 GP for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the Wizard spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of the new book requires you to find new spells to do so. For this reason, many wizards keep a backup spellbook.

classFeature.name: Scholar
entries: Your scholarly efforts bear fruit. While studying magic, you also specialized in an academic field of study. Choose one of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. Your gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the chosen skill. If you are already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} you make with it.

classFeature.name: Arcane Tradition
entries: You choose an arcane tradition from the list of available traditions, shaping your practice of magic. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} offered by your class at 1st level (the {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Swift Memorize
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically extract knowledge from your spellbook and replace one of the level 1+ Wizard spells you have prepared for your Spellcasting feature with another level 1+ spell from the book.
You cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Arcane Tradition feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Arcane Tradition.

classFeature.name: Erudite
entries: Your continued studies broaden your areas of expertise. Choose another skill as per your Scholar feature. Alternatively, you can choose to learn a new language.

classFeature.name: Signature Spells
entries: You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell that are in your spellbook. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot when you have them prepared. If you want to cast either spell at a higher level, you must expend a spell slot as normal.
By spending 8 hours in study, you can exchange one or both of the spells you chose for different spells of the same levels.

classFeature.name: Spell Mastery
entries: Choose two spells in your spellbook as your signature spells. Choose one benefit for each signature spell from the list below. Whenever you cast one of your signature spells, it gains the chosen benefit. You cannot choose the same benefit for both of your signature spells.

entries.name: Intensified
entries: The spell counts as 2 spell levels higher for the purpose of dealing damage.

entries.name: Labyrinthine
entries: The spell cannot be counterspelled or dispelled.

entries.name: Focus
entries: The spell no longer requires {@condition Concentration|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Magnified
entries: The spell's area of effect is doubled.

entries.name: Overhelming
entries: The Spell Save DC for this spell receives a +3 bonus.

subclassFeature.name: School of Abjuration
entries: The School of Abjuration emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects. Detractors of this school say that its tradition is about denial, negation rather than positive assertion. You understand, however, that ending harmful effects, protecting the weak, and banishing evil influences is anything but a philosophical void. It is a proud and respected vocation.

Called abjurers, members of this school are sought when baleful spirits require exorcism, when important locations must be guarded against magical spying, and when portals to other planes of existence must be closed.

subclassFeature.name: Abjuration Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Abjuration school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=A|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Abjuration school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=A|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Ward
entries: You can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an {@filter abjuration spell with a spell slot|spells|school=A|level=!0|source=Ishiir}, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. The ward has a hit point maximum equal to twice your Wizard level plus your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead, and if you have any Resistances or Vulnerabilities, apply them before reducing the ward's hit points. If the damage reduces the ward to 0 Hit Points, you take any remaining damage. While the ward has 0 Hit Points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains.

Whenever you cast an Abjuration spell with a spell slot, the ward regains a number of Hit Points equal to twice the level of the spell slot. Alternatively, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can expend a spell slot, and the ward regains a number of Hit Points equal to twice the level of the spell slot expended. Additionally, the ward regains hit points equal to your proficiency every time you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}.
Once you create the ward, you can't create it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Projected Ward
entries: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Breaker
entries: You always have the {@spell Counterspell|Ishiir} and {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir} spells prepared. In addition, you can cast {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, and you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} Bonus to its {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}.
When you cast either spell with a spell slot, that slot isn't expended if the spell fails to stop a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells.
Furthermore, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against the damage of spells.

subclassFeature.name: Bladesinging
entries: Bladesingers master a tradition of wizardry that incorporates swordplay and dance. Originally created by elves, this tradition has been adopted by non-elf practitioners, who honor and expand on the elven ways.

In combat, a bladesinger uses a series of intricate, elegant maneuvers that fend off harm and allow the bladesinger to channel magic into devastating attacks and a cunning defense. Many who have observed a bladesinger at work remember the display as one of the more beautiful experiences in their life, a glorious dance accompanied by a singing blade.

subclassFeature.name: Bladesinger Styles
entries: From its inception as a martial and magical art, Bladesinging has been tied to the sword, more specifically the longsword. Yet many generations of study gave rise to various styles of Bladesinging based on the melee weapon employed. The techniques of these styles are passed from master to students in small schools, some of which have a building dedicated to instruction. Even the newest styles are hundreds of years old, but are still taught by their original creators due to the long lives of elves. Most schools of Bladesinging are in Evermeet or Evereska. One was started in Myth Drannor, but the city's destruction has scattered those students who survived.

Styles of Bladesinging are broadly categorized based on the type of weapon employed, and each is associated with a category of animal. Within that style are specializations named after specific animal types, based on the types of spells employed, the techniques of the master, and the particular weapon used. Bladesingers who apprentice to a master typically get a tattoo of their chosen style's animal. Some bladesingers learn multiple styles and bear many tattoos, wearing a warning on their skin of their deadly skills.

entries.name: Cat
entries: Styles that employ a sword belong to this family. The lion style, the eldest, trains practitioners in the use of the longsword and doesn't favor any particular type of spells. Leopard style focuses on the shortsword and spells of illusion and stealth. Red tiger, a style just three centuries old, has its bladesingers using the scimitar in a whirling dance of defense from which they launch into sudden leaps and attacks.

entries.name: Bird
entries: Styles that focus on the use of a hafted weapon, such as an axe or hammer, have been grouped together as bird styles, yet they vary wildly. All relatively new styles, they use weapons not typically favored by elves. Eagle-style bladesingers use small handaxes, and many maneuvers in the style focus on fluid ways to throw the weapon and draw a new one. Raven style uses a war pick, and spells associated with it grant the bladesinger more agility in combat.

entries.name: Snake
entries: Practitioners of these styles use a flail, chain, or whip. Viper style uses a whip, despite its inelegance as a weapon, and has almost as long a history as the lion style. Its masters punctuate their bladesong with a stunningly rapid rhythm of whip cracks, which can keep many foes at bay and allow the bladesinger space to cast the cruel spells of poison and disease favored by the style.

subclassFeature.name: Bladesong
entries: You can invoke a secret elven magic called the Bladesong, provided you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield. It graces you with supernatural speed, agility, and focus.

You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to start the Bladesong, which lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, if you don medium or heavy armor or a shield, or if you use two hands to make an attack with a weapon. You can also dismiss Bladesong at any time you choose (no action required).
While your bladesong is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
Your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}.

You gain a bonus to any Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} you make to maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell. The bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

entries: You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Training in War and Song (Bladesinging)
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with light armor, and you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one type of one-handed melee weapon of your choice.
You also gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Performance} skill if you don't already have it.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Defense
entries: You can direct your magic to absorb damage while your bladesong is active. When you take damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend one spell slot and reduce that damage to you by an amount equal to five times the spell's slot level.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Victory
entries: You add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage of your melee weapon attacks while your Bladesong is active.

subclassFeature.name: Chronurgy Magic
entries: Focusing on the manipulation of time, those who follow the Chronurgy tradition learn to alter the pace of reality to their liking. Using the ramping of anticipatory dunamis energy, these mages can bend the flow of time as adroitly as a skilled musician plays an instrument, lending themselves and their allies an {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} in the blink of an eye.

subclassFeature.name: Chronal Shift
entries: You can magically exert limited control over the flow of time around a creature. As a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir}, after you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can force the creature to reroll. You make this decision after you see whether the roll succeeds or fails. The target must use the result of the second roll.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: You can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Momentary Stasis
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically force a Large or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. Unless the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} is a success, the creature is encased in a field of magical energy until the end of your next turn or until the creature takes any damage. While encased in this way, the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} and has a {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 0. This feature ignores {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to the {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir} condition.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Abeyance
entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot of 4th level or lower, you can condense the spell's magic into a mote. The spell is frozen in time at the moment of casting and held within a gray bead for 1 hour. This bead is a Tiny object with AC 15 and 1 hit point, and it is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison and psychic damage. When the duration ends, or if the bead is destroyed, it vanishes in a flash of light, and the spell is lost.

A creature holding the bead can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the bead disappears. The spell uses your spell attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes.
Once you create a bead with this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Convergent Future
entries: You can peer through possible futures and magically pull one of them into events around you, ensuring a particular outcome. When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to ignore the die roll and decide whether the number rolled is the minimum needed to succeed or one less than that number (your choice).

The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage for each level (or CR if the creature has no levels) the target creature has. Each time you use this feature again before finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, the damage increases by {@damage 1d12} per level/CR. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: School of Conjuration
entries: As a conjurer, you favor spells that produce objects and creatures out of thin air. You can conjure billowing clouds of killing fog or summon creatures from elsewhere to fight on your behalf. As your mastery grows, you learn spells of transportation and can teleport yourself across vast distances, even to other planes of existence, in an instant.

subclassFeature.name: Conjuration Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Conjuration school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=C|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Conjuration school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=C|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Benign Transporation
entries: You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Alternatively, you can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, you both teleport, swapping places.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or you expend a 2+ spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Summons
entries: The weapon attacks of any creature you summon with a conjuration spell count as magical for the purpose of overcoming {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Conjuration
entries: While you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Summons
entries: Any creature that you summon or create with a conjuration spell has temporary hit points equal to twice your Wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: School of Divination
entries: The counsel of a diviner is sought by royalty and commoners alike, for all seek a clearer understanding of the past, present, and future. As a diviner, you strive to part the veils of space, time, and consciousness so that you can see clearly. You work to master spells of discernment, remote viewing, supernatural knowledge, and foresight.

subclassFeature.name: Divination Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Divination school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=D|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Divination school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=D|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Portent
entries: When you choose this school, glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, roll two {@dice d20}s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Divination
entries: Casting divination spells comes so easily to you that it expends only a fraction of your spellcasting efforts. When you cast a {@filter divination spell of 2nd level or higher|spells|school=D|source=Ishiir} using a spell slot, you regain spell slots with a combined level one lower than the spell cast. The slot you regain can't be higher than 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: The Third Eye
entries: You can use your action to increase your powers of perception. When you do so, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you take a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can't use the feature again until you finish a rest.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of 120 feet.

entries.name: Greater Comprehension
entries: You can read any language.

entries.name: Truesight
entries: You gain {@sense truesight}, to a distance of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Portent
entries: The visions in your dreams intensify and paint a more accurate picture in your mind of what is to come. You roll three {@dice d20}s for your Portent feature, rather than two.

subclassFeature.name: School of Enchantment
entries: As a member of the School of Enchantment, you have honed your ability to magically entrance and beguile other people and monsters. Some enchanters are peacemakers who bewitch the violent to lay down their arms and charm the cruel into showing mercy. Others are tyrants who magically bind the unwilling into their service. Most enchanters fall somewhere in between.

subclassFeature.name: Enchantment Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Enchantment school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=E|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Enchantment school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=E|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Self
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}. You can use your Intelligence in place of your Charisma for these skills.

When you fail a {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|check} using these skills, you can choose to reroll it, taking either result. Once you have done so and the reroll resulted in a success, you cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctive Charm
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to divert the attack, provided that another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including you or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, you can't use this feature on the attacker again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
You must choose to use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Creatures that can't be {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Split Enchantment
entries: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.

subclassFeature.name: Alter Memories
entries: You gain the ability to make a creature unaware of your magical influence on it. When you cast an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, you can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}.

Additionally, once before the spell expires, you can use your action to try to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}. The creature must succeed on an Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your wizard spell save DC or lose a number of hours of its memories equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You can make the creature forget less time, and the amount of time can't exceed the duration of your enchantment spell.

subclassFeature.name: School of Evocation
entries: You focus your study on magic that creates powerful elemental effects such as bitter cold, searing flame, rolling thunder, crackling lightning, and burning acid. Some evokers find employment in military forces, serving as artillery to blast enemy armies from afar. Others use their spectacular power to protect the weak, while some seek their own gain as bandits, adventurers, or aspiring tyrants.

subclassFeature.name: Evocation Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Evocation school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=V|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Evocation school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=V|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When you cast a cantrip at a creature and you miss with the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} or the target succeeds on a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against the cantrip, the target takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocations. When you cast an Evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 plus the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: You can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Overchannel
entries: You can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a wizard spell that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell.

The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you take {@damage 2d12} necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it. Each time you use this feature again before finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, the necrotic damage per spell level increases by {@dice 1d12}. This damage ignores {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} and {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Graviturgy Magic
entries: Understanding and mastering the forces that draw bodies of matter together or drive them apart, the students of the Graviturgy arcane tradition learn to further bend and manipulate the violent energy of gravity to their benefit, and the terrible detriment of their enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Adjust Density
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically alter the weight of one object or creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The object or creature must be Large or smaller. The target's weight is halved or doubled until the end of your next turn.

While the weight of a creature is halved by this effect, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by 10 feet, it can jump twice as far as normal, and it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}. While the weight of a creature is doubled by this effect, the creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced by 10 feet, and it has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on strength {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} and Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
Upon reaching 10th level in this class, you can target an object or a creature that is Huge or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Well
entries: You've learned how to manipulate gravity around a living being: whenever you cast a spell on a creature, you can move the target up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice if the target is willing to move, the spell hits it with an attack, or it fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against the spell.
Upon reaching 10th level in this class, the maximum distance you can move a creature in this manner increases to 20 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Violent Attraction
entries: When you cast a gravity-based spell (e.g. {@spell Magnify Gravity|Ishiir}) that deals force damage, you add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell.

Additionally, if a creature you can see within 60 feet of you takes damage from a fall, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal additional force damage equal to a number of D10s x your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} to the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Event Horizon
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can magically emit a powerful field of gravitational energy that tugs at other creatures for up to 1 minute or until your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). For the duration, whenever a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 60 feet of you, it must make a Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d10} + Intelligence modifier force damage, and its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage, and every foot it moves this turn costs 2 extra feet of movement.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} or until you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Magic
entries: When a creature makes a Wisdom or Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against spells cast by you, you can force it to make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} instead. If the spell you used this feature on allows for a repeat {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} on subsequent turns, these also become Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}. You cannot use this feature if the creature has no blood.

Additionally, creatures that fail their Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against spells cast by you also become {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}. If the spell natively causes them to become {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir}, the damage they take from the condition increases by an amount equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

At the end of their turns, they can make another Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC to end the condition. They do not make this {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} if the spell triggering this effect is still affecting them and allows for repeat {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} on subsequent turns. In such a case, the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} condition instead ends when they succeed on the repeat {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} for that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Sacrifice
entries: When you take a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} and use your Arcane Recovery class feature, you can spend a number of hit dice up to equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier. The number of hit dice spent in this manner is added to the total level of spell slots that you can recover with Arcane Recovery.

Additionally, if a creature within 30 feet of you takes slashing or piercing damage or takes damage from the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} condition, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to deal force damage equal to your hemomancer level to that creature. You then regain hitpoints equal to half the damage dealt. You also regain a hit die, unless you are already at the hit dice maximum for your character level.

You can only use this feature against creatures with blood and up to a total number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Sight
entries: You gain a special kind of {@sense Blindsight} with a radius of 120 feet. This {@sense Blindsight} only functions against creatures with blood.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Ravage
entries: Your mastery over blood magic transcends the mere physical. You ignore {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to the {@condition Lacerated|Ishiir} condition and the blood requirement (both for the target creature and for material components) for class features and spells.

Additionally, whenever a creature you can see with this feature makes a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to force that creature to make that {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus. You gain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: School of Illusion
entries: You focus your studies on magic that dazzles the senses, befuddles the mind, and tricks even the wisest folk. Your magic is subtle, but the illusions crafted by your keen mind make the impossible seem real. Some illusionists—including many gnome wizards—are benign tricksters who use their spells to entertain. Others are more sinister masters of deception, using their illusions to frighten and fool others for their personal gain.

subclassFeature.name: Illusion Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Illusion school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=I|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Illusion school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=I|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Illusions
entries: You can cast Illusion spells without providing Verbal components, and if an Illusion spell you cast has a range of 10+ feet, the range increases by 60 feet.

You also know the {@spell Minor Illusion|Ishiir} cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different Wizard cantrip of your choice. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. You can create both a sound and an image with a single casting of {@spell Minor Illusion|Ishiir}, and you can cast it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Self
entries: When a creature hits you with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to interpose an illusory duplicate of yourself between the attacker and yourself. The attack automatically misses you, then the illusion dissipates.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 2+ spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Phantasmal Spells
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage and is not an Illusion spell, you can change its school to Illusion and its damage type to psychic. If the spell requires a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, that saving throw becomes a Wisdom saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Reality
entries: You have learned the secret of weaving shadow magic into your illusions to give them a semireality. When you cast an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. You can do this on your turn as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 1 minute. For example, you can create an illusion of a bridge over a chasm and then make it real long enough for your allies to cross.
The object can't deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

subclassFeature.name: Lore Mastery
entries: Lore Mastery is an arcane tradition fixated on understanding the underlying mechanics of magic. It is the most academic of all arcane traditions. The promise of uncovering new knowledge or proving (or discrediting) a theory of magic is usually required to rouse its practitioners from their laboratories, academies, and archives to pursue a life of adventure.

Known as savants, followers of this tradition are a bookish lot who see beauty and mystery in the application of magic. The results of a spell are less interesting to them than the process that creates it. Some savants take a haughty attitude toward those who follow a tradition focused on a single school of magic, seeing them as provincial and lacking the sophistication needed to master true magic. Other savants are generous teachers, countering ignorance and deception with deep knowledge and good humor.

subclassFeature.name: Lore Master
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two of the following skills: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Deception}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Performance}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Religion}, {@skill Survival}.

Alternatively, you may replace a chosen skill with one of the following tools: {@item Alchemist's Supplies|Ishiir}, {@item Cook's Utensils|Ishiir}, {@item Enchanter's Supplies|Ishiir}, {@item Herbalism Kit|PHB|Herbalist's Kit}, {@item Poisoner's Kit|Ishiir}, or Tinkerer's Tools.

If you are already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in a chosen skill or tool, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} you make with it.
Additionally, you can use Intelligence for skill {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} with a chosen skill or tool if it normally uses a different ability score.
You can choose two additional skills or tools for this feature when you reach 10th level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Extensive Study
entries: You learn an additional spell from the wizard spell list. The spell must fulfill all the usual criteria for learning a wizard spell of 1st level or higher. You learn an additional spell in this manner at the following levels in this class: 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Secrets
entries: You learn two spells of your choice from any class. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Wizard table, or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as wizard spells for you and don't count against the number of wizard spells you can prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Prodigious Memory
entries: The number of spells you can prepare is increased by half your wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Mastery
entries: You gain one feat of your choice. You ignore all race, class, and level prerequisites the feat normally has. You do not, however, gain any features that the feat might depend on.

subclassFeature.name: School of Necromancy
entries: The School of Necromancy explores the cosmic forces of life, death, and undeath. As you focus your studies in this tradition, you learn to manipulate the energy that animates all living things. As you progress, you learn to sap the life force from a creature as your magic destroys its body, transforming that vital energy into magical power you can manipulate.

Most people see necromancers as menacing, or even villainous, due to the close association with death. Not all necromancers are evil, but the forces they manipulate are considered taboo by many societies.

subclassFeature.name: Negative Energy Manipulation
entries: You have a pool of deathly energy represented by a number of points equal to twice your Wizard level + your Intelligence modifier.
When you roll damage for a necromancy spell or an undead you control, you can deal additional necrotic damage by spending points from the pool, up to its current maximum.

When a creature of at least CR 1/8 dies within 60 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to harvest part of its remaining life force, regaining a number of points equal to the creature's CR (minimum of 1). You cannot do so if the creature is an undead or construct.

You regain expended points equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} and all expended points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Necromancy Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Necromancy school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=N|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Necromancy school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=N|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Thralls
entries: You always have the {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir} and {@spell Summon Undead|Ishiir} spells prepared and they do not count against the number of your prepared spells. When you cast {@spell Animate Dead|Ishiir}, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, creating another zombie or skeleton, as appropriate.
Any undead creature you control has the following additional benefits:

items: The creature's hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your wizard level.
The creature adds your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to its weapon damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Inured to Undeath
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced. You have spent so much time dealing with undead and the forces that animate them that you have become inured to some of their worst effects.

subclassFeature.name: Command Undead
entries: You can use magic to bring undead under your control, even those created by other wizards. As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can choose one undead that you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your wizard spell save DC. If it succeeds, you can't use this feature on it again. If it fails, it becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands until you use this feature again.

Intelligent undead are harder to control in this way. If the target has an Intelligence of 8 or higher, it has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. If it fails the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and has an Intelligence of 12 or higher, it can repeat the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} at the end of every hour until it succeeds and breaks free.

subclassFeature.name: Psionics
entries: Wizards study magical power in all its forms, including the magic of psionics. Those wizards who follow the tradition of Psionics hone the magical potential of their own minds. Sometimes called psionicists or mentalists, these wizards interact with the multiverse through the lens of their psionic aptitude and awareness.

Psionicists channel their magic by focusing their minds. By doing so they can transcend their physical bodies, adopting forms of pure thought, casting spells psionically to bypass the need for components, and perceiving the world with a broader range of senses.

As a member of the Psionics tradition, you might have awoken your psionic potential through the strain of your esoteric studies, or perhaps you joined a scholarly order dedicated to unlocking the magic of the mind.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Devotion
entries: Your study of psionics begins to unleash your mind's potential. When you gain this feature, choose one of the following cantrips: friends, mage hand, or message. You learn that cantrip if you don't already know it, and it doesn't count against the number of wizard cantrips you know. While your psionic focus is on your person, you can cast the chosen cantrip as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, requiring no components, and with the modification listed below:

entries.name: Friends
entries: When the spell ends, the target doesn't become hostile to you.

entries.name: Mage Hand
entries: You can make the hand {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} when you cast the spell, and controlling the spell is a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} for you.

entries.name: Message
entries: You don't need to point toward the target or whisper your message out loud.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Focus
entries: You use yourself as a Spellcasting Focus and you can ignore verbal components for your wizard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Spells
entries: Spell selection is part of what defines a wizard and their individual fields of expertise. When creating your Psionics wizard, consider spells that are thematically appropriate for that tradition. Psionics as a theme generally includes spells that do the following:

items: contact or manipulate minds
allow the caster to perceive distant locations or planes
alter perception
move objects and creatures
teleport
deal psychic or force damage

subclassFeature.name: Your Psionic Focus
entries: Every member of the Psionics tradition has a story about how their psionic focus came into their life. Consider how you found yours and what form it takes.

The event that brought your psionic focus to you probably holds personal significance. Did your master give it to you upon the completion of your apprenticeship? Was it awarded to you when you graduated from your academy of wizardry? Did it call to you in a jeweler's shop? Was it associated with the moment when your psionic powers first manifested? One morning, did you wake up with it humming under your pillow?

The form your psionic focus takes is also yours to define, likely being a reflection of how your magic came into being, a symbol of your own psyche, or an item you use to focus your thoughts. It is a handheld object that has special meaning to you, but that can't be a weapon or magic item. Perhaps it's a childhood memento, the skull of an alien creature, a crystal that makes you feel a certain way, a coin that only lands on its edge, a firescarred planchette, or any other enigmatic personal relic.

However the object arrived and whatever form it takes, your psionic focus is now yours, and you decide how to handle it. Will you mount it on a wand or staff? Would you prefer to wear it on a necklace or circlet? Have you embedded it into the cover of your spellbook? Wherever you put it, you can now channel your magic through it, and it is a sign of your membership in the revered tradition of psionic wizardry.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Defenses
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic damage. When you have to make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can make an Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} instead.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Psionics
entries: When you deal psychic or force damage with a wizard spell, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage against one of the spell's targets.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Mastery
entries: You ignore {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to psychic and force damage, and you treat {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to them as {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} instead. Additionally, you double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} for Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

subclassFeature.name: Runecrafter
entries: Runecrafter wizards enhance their spellcasting through the ancient power of runes. Though the tradition originated with the giant rune casters of old, runecraft magic has expanded to encompass countless languages and practitioners across different worlds.

For many runecrafters, the runes they wield are as every bit unique and personal as their spellbook. Some strive to honor the practice's origins among the giants, engraving their runes on decorative stones that adorn their spellcasting implements, while others messily scribble their runes on scraps of paper.

subclassFeature.name: Runes of Understanding
entries: Your study of runecraft has unlocked the ability to decode runes and languages, regardless of their origin; you always have comprehend languages prepared, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, and the spell doesn't count against the number of spells you have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Empowerment
entries: When you choose this subclass, you learn how to amplify your magic through the application of various runes. Your knowledge of these runes is stored in your spellbook, though you determine the runes' cosmetic appearance. For example, your runes could be engraved into the cover of your spellbook, glowing whenever you cast a spell, or you could work the shape and meaning of the runes directly into a spell's somatic and verbal components. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can invoke one of the following runes:

items.name: Life Rune
entries: When you invoke this rune, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you (you can choose yourself). The chosen creature gains temporary hit points equal to 5 times the level of the spell slot expended.

items.name: War Rune
entries: When you invoke this rune, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} that target the chosen creature gain a bonus equal to half the level of the spell slot expended (rounded up, minimum of +1).

items.name: Wind Rune
entries: When you invoke this rune, your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times the level of the spell slot expended, and your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. These benefits last until the start of your next turn.

You can invoke no more than one rune per spell. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Sigils of Warding
entries: You can call on a rune of protection to guard yourself against threats. When you fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to expend one use of your Runic Empowerment and succeed on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} instead.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Maven
entries: Your understanding of runecraft has grown immensely. Whenever you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you also regain a number of your expended uses of Runic Empowerment. The number of uses you regain can be no more than half your Intelligence modifier, rounded up (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Engraved Enmity
entries: You have mastered the art of wielding your runes directly against your foes. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can target one creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC or be magically marked by an enmity rune.
The enmity rune appears as a faintly glowing mote of energy that hovers over the marked creature, which suffers the following effects:

items.name: Runecraft's Bane
entries: The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} made against spells you cast.

items.name: Unveiled Enemy
entries: The radiance of the glowing rune makes the creature visible if it's {@condition Invisible|Ishiir}, and the creature can't become {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} while the rune persists.

items.name: Woeful Curse
entries: When you mark the creature, and as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} on subsequent turns for the duration, you can invoke the enmity rune to curse the creature until the start of your next turn. The next time one of your allies hits the cursed creature with an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, the target also takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

The enmity rune lasts for 1 minute or until you lose your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} (as if you were concentrating on a spell). Once you have marked a creature in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Order of Scribes
entries: Magic of the book-that's what many folk call wizardry. The name is apt, given how much time wizards spend poring over tomes and penning theories about the nature of magic. It's rare to see wizards traveling without books and scrolls sprouting from their bags, and a wizard would go to great lengths to plumb an archive of ancient knowledge.

Among wizards, the Order of Scribes is the most bookish. It takes many forms in different worlds, but its primary mission is the same everywhere: recording magical discoveries so that wizardry can flourish. And while all wizards value spellbooks, a wizard in the Order of Scribes magically awakens their book, turning it into a trusted companion. All wizards study books, but a wizardly scribe talks to theirs!

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Spellbook
entries: Using specially prepared inks and ancient incantations passed down by your wizardly order, you have awakened an arcane sentience within your spellbook.
While you are holding the book, it grants you the following benefits:

items: You can use the book as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.

When you cast a wizard spell with a spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with a type that appears in another spell in your spellbook, which magically alters the spell's formula for this casting only. The latter spell must be of the same level as the spell slot you expend.

When you cast a wizard spell as a ritual, you can use the spell's normal casting time, rather than adding 10 minutes to it. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries: If necessary, you can replace the book over the course of a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} by using your Wizardly Quill to write arcane sigils in a blank book or a magic spellbook to which you're attuned. At the end of the rest, your spellbook's consciousness is summoned into the new book, which the consciousness transforms into your spellbook, along with all its spells. If the previous book still existed somewhere, all the spells vanish from its pages.

subclassFeature.name: Wizardly Quill
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can magically create a Tiny quill in your free hand. The magic quill has the following properties:

items: The quill doesn't require ink. When you write with it, it produces ink in a color of your choice on the writing surface.
The time you must spend to copy a spell into your spellbook equals 2 minutes per spell level if you use the quill for the transcription.
You can erase anything you write with the quill if you wave the feather over the text as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, provided the text is within 5 feet of you.

entries: This quill disappears if you create another one or if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Mind
entries: You can conjure forth the mind of your Awakened Spellbook. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} while the book is on your person, you can cause the mind to manifest as a Tiny spectral object, hovering in an unoccupied space of your choice within 60 feet of you. The spectral mind is intangible and doesn't occupy its space, and it sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. It looks like a ghostly tome, a cascade of text, or a scholar from the past (your choice).
While manifested, the spectral mind can hear and see, and it has {@sense darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. The mind can telepathically share with you what it sees and hears (no action required).

Whenever you cast a wizard spell on your turn, you can cast it as if you were in the spectral mind's space, instead of your own, using its senses. You can do so a number of times per day equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can cause the spectral mind to hover up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you or it can see. It can pass through creatures but not objects.

The spectral mind stops manifesting if it is ever more than 300 feet away from you, if someone casts {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir} on it, if the Awakened Spellbook is destroyed, if you die, or if you dismiss the spectral mind as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.
Once you conjure the mind, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, unless you expend a spell slot of any level to conjure it again.

subclassFeature.name: Master Scrivener
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can create a number of magic scroll equal to half your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus (rounded down) by touching your Wizardly Quill to a blank piece of paper or parchment and causing spells from your Awakened Spellbook to be copied onto the scrolls. The spellbook must be within 5 feet of you when you make the scrolls.

The chosen spells must be of 1st or 2nd level and must have a casting time of 1 action. Once in the scrolls, the spells' power is enhanced, counting as one level higher than normal. You can cast a spell from one of the scrolls by reading one as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. The scrolls are unintelligible to anyone else, and the spell vanishes from the scroll when you cast it or when you finish your next {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

You are also adept at crafting spell scrolls, which are described in the treasure chapter of the Dungeon Master's Guide. The gold and time you must spend to make such a scroll are halved if you use your Wizardly Quill.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Word
entries: Your connection to your Awakened Spellbook has become so profound that your soul has become entwined with it. While the book is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks}, as the spellbook helps you remember magical lore.

Moreover, if you take damage while your spellbook's mind is manifested, you can prevent all of that damage to you by using your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to dismiss the spectral mind, using its magic to save yourself.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

subclassFeature.name: Theurgy
entries: A number of deities claim arcane magic as their domain, for magic is as much a part of the fabric of the cosmos as wind, fire, lightning, and all other primal forces. Just as there are deities of the sea and gods of warfare, the arcane arts feature their own divine patrons.

Such deities often have clerics, but many gods of magic bid their followers to take up the study of wizardry. These religious magic-users follow the arcane tradition of Theurgy, and are commonly known as theurgists. Such spellcasters are as dedicated and scholarly as any other wizard, but they blend their arcane study with religious devotion.

subclassFeature.name: Ecclesitheurgy
entries: You learn two cantrips and two spells from the cleric spell list. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Wizard table. Whenever you gain a wizard level after this one, you can replace one of the wizard spells you add to your spellbook with a spell from the cleric spell list. Any of the spells gained in this manner count as wizard spells for you.
Additionally, you can copy cleric spells into your spellbook from scrolls or the spellbooks of other theurgists. If you do so, they count as wizard spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Student of the Divine
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Religion} skill. If you are already {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} in the skill, you add double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} you make with it.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divine Energy
entries: You learn to harness divine energy to heal your allies or harm your foes. You have a pool of d6s equal to your wizard level. If you use a feature that uses these dice, the number of dice you expend can be no larger than half your wizard level (rounded down). You regain all expended dice when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Heal
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, expend a number of d6s from your pool and roll them. Choose creatures within 30 feet of you that you can see. Each target is healed by an amount of equal to the total of the roll.

entries.name: Harm
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, expend a number of d6s from your pool and roll them. Choose creatures within 30 feet of you that you can see. Each target has to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against your spell save DC. On a failure, it takes an amount of damage of a type you choose when you gain this feature (cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or radiant) equal to the total of the roll. On a success, it takes half as much damage. If the target is an undead or a fiend, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, and the feature deals maximum damage to it.

subclassFeature.name: Theotic Conduit
entries: Your ability to harness divine energy improves further. You regain a number of dice every time you expend a spell slot to cast a spell from the cleric spell list. The number of dice you regain is equal to the level of the expended spell slot. Additionally, the dice from your pool change to d8s.

subclassFeature.name: Henotic Ascendence
entries: Your connection to the realm of the divine permanently changes you. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to the damage type you chose for the Harm effect of your Channel Divine Energy class feature. For every 10 years that pass, your body only ages 1 year. Additionally, the dice from your pool change to d10s.

subclassFeature.name: School of Transmutation
entries: You are a student of spells that modify energy and matter. To you, the world is not a fixed thing, but eminently mutable, and you delight in being an agent of change. You wield the raw stuff of creation and learn to alter both physical forms and mental qualities. Your magic gives you the tools to become a smith on reality's forge.

Some transmuters are tinkerers and pranksters, turning people into toads and transforming copper into silver for fun and occasional profit. Others pursue their magical studies with deadly seriousness, seeking the power of the gods to make and destroy worlds.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Crafting
entries: When you select this school, you gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one tool of your choice. If you make a check to craft something, you can substitute your Intelligence for the ability score you would normally use for the crafting attempt. You can also use your arcane focus in place of the required tool.

subclassFeature.name: Transmutation Savant
entries: Choose two {@filter Wizard spells from the Transmutation school|spells|level=1;2|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=T|source=Ishiir}, each of which must be no higher than level 2, and add them to your spellbook for free.

In addition, whenever you gain access to a new level of spell slots in this class, you can add one {@filter Wizard spell from the Transmutation school|spells|class=Wizard (Ishiir)|school=T|source=Ishiir} to your spellbook for free. The chosen spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: You can spend 8 hours creating a transmuter's stone that stores transmutation magic. You can benefit from the stone yourself or give it to another creature. A creature gains a benefit of your choice as long as the stone is in the creature's possession. When you create the stone, choose the benefit from the following options:

items: Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet, as described in chapter 8.
An increase to {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} of 10 feet while the creature is unencumbered.
{@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
{@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice whenever you choose this benefit).

entries: Each time you cast a transmutation spell of 1st level or higher, you can change the effect of your stone if the stone is on your person.
If you create a new transmuter's stone, the previous one ceases to function.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Transmutation
entries: While you are concentrating on a {@filter transmutation|spells|school=T|source=Ishiir} spell, your {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

subclassFeature.name: Master Transmuter
entries: You can use your action to consume the reserve of transmutation magic stored within your transmuter's stone in a single burst. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} when you do so, choose one of the following effects.

entries.name: Major Transformation
entries: You can transmute one nonmagical object—no larger than a 5-foot cube—into another nonmagical object of similar size and mass and of equal or lesser value. You must spend 10 minutes handling the object to transform it.

entries.name: Panacea
entries: You remove all curses, diseases, and poisons affecting a creature that you touch with the transmuter's stone. The creature also regains all its hit points.

entries.name: Restore Life
entries: You cast the {@spell Raise Dead|Ishiir} spell on a creature you touch with the transmuter's stone, without expending a spell slot or needing to have the spell in your spellbook.

entries.name: Restore Youth
entries: You touch the transmuter's stone to a willing creature, and that creature's apparent age is reduced by {@dice 3d10} years, to a minimum of 13 years. This effect doesn't extend the creature's lifespan and can be used no more than once on the same creature.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: A variety of arcane colleges specialize in training wizards for war. The tradition of War Magic blends principles of evocation and abjuration, rather than specializing in either of those schools. It teaches techniques that empower a caster's spells, while also providing methods for wizards to bolster their own defenses.

Followers of this tradition are known as war mages. They see their magic as both a weapon and armor, a resource superior to any piece of steel. War mages act fast in battle, using their spells to seize tactical control of a situation. Their spells strike hard, while their defensive skills foil their opponents' attempts to counterattack. War mages are also adept at turning other spellcasters' magical energy against them.

In great battles, a war mage often works with evokers, abjurers, and other types of wizards. Evokers, in particular, sometimes tease war mages for splitting their attention between offense and defense. A war mage's typical response: "What good is being able to throw a mighty {@spell Fireball|Ishiir} if I die before I can cast it?"

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Deflection
entries: You have learned to weave your magic to fortify yourself against harm. When you are hit by an attack or you fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to gain a +2 bonus to your AC against that attack or a +4 bonus to that {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}.
When you use this feature, you can't cast spells other than cantrips until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Wit
entries: Your keen ability to assess tactical situations allows you to act quickly in battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Anti-Magic Training
entries: You learn the {@spell Counterspell|Ishiir} and {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir} spells if you do not know them already and always have them prepared. When you cast {@spell Counterspell|Ishiir} or {@spell Dispel Magic|Ishiir}, they count as one spell level higher for the purpose of automatically succeeding.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Magic
entries: The magic you channel helps ward off harm. While you maintain {@condition Concentration|Ishiir} on a spell, you have a +2 bonus to AC and all {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

subclassFeature.name: Deflecting Shroud
entries: Your Arcane Deflection becomes infused with deadly magic. When you use your Arcane Deflection feature, you can cause magical energy to arc from you. Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within 60 feet of you each take force damage equal to half your wizard level.
